metadata.name: Zone::Transaction
metadata.description:
DNS Zone Transaction

This object is used by Zone#update when passed a block. These methods are used to update the records that are sent to the Google Cloud DNS API.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.update do |tx|
  tx.add     "example.com.", "A",  86400, "1.2.3.4"
  tx.remove  "example.com.", "TXT"
  tx.replace "example.com.", "MX", 86400, ["10 mail1.example.com.",
                                           "20 mail2.example.com."]
  tx.modify "www.example.com.", "CNAME" do |cname|
    cname.ttl = 86400 # only change the TTL
  end
end

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.update do |tx|
  tx.add     "example.com.", "A",  86400, "1.2.3.4"
end

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: ttl
params.description:
The number of seconds that the record can be
cached by resolvers.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: 192.0.2.1 or example.com..

metadata.name: remove
metadata.description: Removes records from the Zone. The records are looked up before they are removed.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.update do |tx|
  tx.remove  "example.com.", "TXT"
end

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

metadata.name: replace
metadata.description: Replaces existing records on the Zone. Records matching the name and type are replaced.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.update do |tx|
  tx.replace "example.com.", "MX", 86400, ["10 mail1.example.com.",
                                           "20 mail2.example.com."]
end

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: ttl
params.description:
The number of seconds that the record can be
cached by resolvers.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: 192.0.2.1 or example.com..

metadata.name: modify
metadata.description: Modifies records on the Zone. Records matching the name and type are yielded to the block where they can be modified.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone.update do |tx|
  tx.modify "www.example.com.", "CNAME" do |cname|
    cname.ttl = 86400 # only change the TTL
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding each matching record
